course_title: Special Topics: Film and Media: International Film Festivals
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 15Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
MCP elective.
International Film Festivals will cover a variety of topics in film festival cultures: theories, histories, and practices. Using several festivals as case studies, the course will examine some of the deeper, layered issues at stake in studying individual festivals, such as their historical origins, organizational structures, operational mechanisms, and relative positions in national, regional, and global cinema cultures. A central concern of the course will be to help students comprehend the cultural factors and considerations involved in curatorial, programming, and accreditation processes in various festivals. Moreover, we will discuss their important influences on production, circulation, and exhibition within the film industry.
course_description: Rotating topics in film and media. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 101 or FILM_OX 101 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
